description:
The PAYOR_COMM_HX table contains a history of communications sent to payers by inpatient case managers. This data is from the Payer Communication navigator section. Each row represents a communication that was sent to a payer.





If no communication was sent to a specific payer, a row will appear for that payer with the current fax and phone number. In addition, a row will also be displayed for any fax and/or phone number updates, if the update happened after sending the last communication. Therefore, the last row for a given payer contains the most current fax and phone number for them.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: AGENCY_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the payor communication recipient.

columns.name: ROI_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the release of information disclosure record; the disclosure stores all information about the communication itself, such as sending time and user.

columns.name: LRP_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the report that was sent to the payor. This column is always populated when a report is sent, but should only be used as a fallback if no Release of Information (ROI) is available in ROI_ID (such as in an IntraConnect scenario).

columns.name: SENT_DTTM
columns.description: The instant that the report was sent. This column is always populated when a report is sent, but should only be used as a fallback if no Release of Information (ROI) is available in ROI_ID (such as in an IntraConnect scenario).

columns.name: OVERRIDE_FAX
columns.description: The fax number that was used or will be used for faxing the communication.

columns.name: OVERRIDE_PHONE
columns.description: The phone number for the recipient at the time the communication was sent, or the most current phone number for the recipient.

columns.name: COMM_MODE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Method by which the communication was sent.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Fax


Save to File

columns.name: OVERRIDE_CT_NAME
columns.description: The contact person name for the recipient at the time the communication was sent, or the most current contact person name for the recipient.

columns.name: ORIG_SEND_LN
columns.description: If this line documents a resent report, this column includes the LINE number (in this table) of the line documenting the original sending of that report. This column is NULL on lines documenting an original sending.

columns.name: COMM_MEMO_NOTE_ID
columns.description: This column contains the note ID of a note containing user comments about the related communication sent to the payer.
